column4: I think I broke Amarok, it won't load up. It just freezes at the splash screen.

Anyone know where I can go from here? I suspect I messed up the config file that amarok uses. It won't load up. I've tried uninstalling, purging, purging and removing the folder that holds the settings, nothing works.
amarok has config files in .kde too ...
I know, I uninstalled and deleted the amarok folder under .kde
